5.Title: The Cheap Resources

18.Snark: I shall call him Skippy. Like the peanut butter. Only tastier.

30.Title: Veggies!
30.Description: You may also trash this card for 2 Food.
30.Snark: Personally, I find grain to much more filling than vegetables.

34.Title: Rare, But Valuable Glass
34.Snark: Just don't miss your opportunity to use it.

35.Title: Rare, But Valuable Glass
35.Snark: Just don't miss your opportunity to use it.

36.Title: Rare, But Valuable Glass
36.Snark: Just don't miss your opportunity to use it.

37.Title: Some Gold Coins
37.Description: At any time, you may substitute 2 Gold for any Resource when playing a card.
37.Snark: Think of it like breeding VPs.

38.Title: Some Gold Coins
38.Description: At any time, you may substitute 2 Gold for any Resource when playing a card.
38.Snark: Think of it like breeding VPs.

39.Description: At any time, you may substitute 2 Gold for any Resource when playing a card.
39.Snark: Think of it like breeding VPs.

40.Title: Free Food!
40.Snark: Plus, you don't have to think about how to make your food!

41.Title: Free Food!

45.Title: Rotating Advantage
45.Description: Each turn, take an extra Resource card. Other players may transfer this card to their playing area for one of any of the following: Stone, Silk, Gold, Cattle, Veggie.
45.Snark: Just in case you needed another option to consider.

46.Title: An Early Investment
46.Snark: Does nothing now, but it will pay off later. The engine can wait.

47.Title: An Early Investment
47.Snark: Does nothing now, but it will pay off later. The engine can wait.

48.Title: The Building Building Building
48.Description: You may now build buildings. You may take only one of these into your hand.
48.Snark: Really, it's just a coincidence that we happen to also be housed in a building. In fact, we built our own building. We did not need a building building building building building.

49.Title: The Building Building Building
49.Description: You may now build buildings. You may take only one of these into your hand.
49.Snark: Really, it's just a coincidence that we happen to also be housed in a building. In fact, we built our own building. We did not need a building building building building building.

52.Title: The Military Strategy
52.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource. Ties don't count.

53.Title: The Military Strategy
53.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource. Ties don't count.

54.Title: The Military Strategy
54.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource for any 1 other Resource. Ties don't count.

55.Title: More Grain!
55.Description: You may also trash this card for 1 Food

56.Title: More Grain!
56.Description: You may also trash this card for 1 Food

57.Title: More Veggies!
57.Description: You may also trash this card for 2 Food

58.Title: More Veggies!
58.Description: You may also trash this card for 2 Food

59.Title: The Grain Engine
59.Description: You may use 1 Grain for any 1 Resource, once per play.

60.Title: Insta-slaughter
60.Description: You may substitute 1 Animal for 1 Food, any number of times.
60.Snark: Can we go back to an abstract theme please?

61.Title: Insta-slaughter
61.Description: You may substitute 1 Animal for 1 Food, any number of times.
61.Snark: Can we go back to an abstract theme please?

62.Title: Silk Market
62.Description: You may substitute 1 Silk for any 1 Resource, any number of times.
62.Snark: Be sure to take this from someone who has collected silk.

63.Title: The Artificial Need
63.Description: Give one to each player. To trash this card, you must trash 3 Food.
63.Snark: Food is how we keep you from making powerful moves. You're welcome.

64.Title: The Artificial Need
64.Description: Give one to each player. To trash this card, you must trash 3 Food.
64.Snark: Food is how we keep you from making powerful moves. You're welcome.

65.Title: The Artificial Need
65.Description: Give one to each player. To trash this card, you must trash 3 Food.
65.Snark: Food is how we keep you from making powerful moves. You're welcome.

66.Title: The Artificial Need
66.Description: Give one to each player. To trash this card, you must trash 3 Food.
66.Snark: Food is how we keep you from making powerful moves. You're welcome.

67.Title: The Stone Building Building
67.Description: You do not need to pay any required Stone for Buildings.
67.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need stone for our building.

68.Title: The Wood Building Building
68.Description: You do not need to pay any required Wood for Buildings
68.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need Wood for our building.

69.Title: The Clay Building Building
69.Description: You do not need to pay any required Clay for Buildings.
69.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need Clay for our building.

70.Title: The Wood Building
70.Snark: Hey, VPs are VPs. Every little bit counts.

71.Title: The Clay Building
71.Snark: Nice! Way to get some points on the board.

72.Title: The Stone Building
72.Snark: Seems like a lot now, but we have an epic endgame coming up.

73.Title: The Clay, Wood Building
73.Snark: Nice! Way to get some bigger points on the board.

74.Title: The Clay, Stone Building
74.Snark: Don't get all your VPs too early now.

75.Title: The Wood, Stone Building
75.Snark: Just when you think you've pulled ahead, someone else will get a bigger building than this.

76.Title: The Military Building
76.Description: You may only play this if you already have at least 1 Military.
76.Snark: And how do we feel about going military right about now?

77.Title: Sheep Breed!
77.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

78.Title: Sheep Breed!
78.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

79.Title: Sheep Breed!
79.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

80.Title: The Cattle Engine
80.Description: You may use 1 Cattle for 2 Food, or 1 Cattle for any other Resource.
80.Snark: Wish this had come out sooner…

81.Title: Cattle Breed!
81.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

82.Title: Cattle Breed!
82.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

83.Title: The Cooking Building
83.Description: You may use 2 Grain or 1 Vegetable for any 1 Resource.
83.Snark: Flexible, if you invested in farming.

84.Title: The Cooking Building
84.Description: You may use 2 Grain or 1 Vegetable for any 1 Resource.
84.Snark: Flexible, if you invested in farming.

85.Title: The Cattle Building
85.Snark: Hopefully you didn’t spend all your cattle on Food.

86.Title: The Cattle Building
86.Snark: Hopefully you didn’t spend all your cattle on Food.

87.Title: Grow, Grain, Grow!
87.Description: You may also use this card for 1 Food
87.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

88.Title: Veggie Patch!
88.Description: You may also use this card for 2 Food
88.Snark: This is a garden, not some sort of weird patch that passively injects beta-Carotene into your skin.

89.Title: The Dude
89.Description: When played, place in front of the player to your left. Subsequent players must trash 1 Food and to continue passing.
89.Snark: One move of the dude is a four-point swing. Don't ever forget about him.

90.Title: The Obligatory 3:1 Trader
90.Description: When playing a card, you may substitute 3 of any single Resource for 1 of any Resource
90.Snark: I'm sure I'll use this enough to justify its purchase.

91.Title: Expand Your Hand
91.Description: You may hold  10 cards instead of the usual 7
91.Snark: Not sure how glass accomplishes this.

92.Title: The Arms Race
92.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. Ties don't count.
92.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

93.Title: The Arms Race
93.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. Ties don't count.
93.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

94.Title: The Arms Race
94.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. Ties don't count.
94.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

95.Title: The Arms Race
95.Description: If you currently have the most military you may substitute any 1 Resource to play a card. Ties don't count.
95.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

96.Title: The Unfair Deck Dive
96.Description: Upon playing this card, you may obtain any card in the Resource deck.
96.Snark: Playing this has the hidden advantage of making your opponents hate you.

97.Title: That One Strategy
97.Description: Instead of a Wood or Stone, you may substitute 1 Animal once per play.
97.Snark: Forget the theme. We need a card that does this.

98.Title: The Expensive Engine
98.Description: You may use 1 Resource for other Resource, once per turn.
98.Snark: Don't base your entire strategy on this card.

99.Title: The Animal Engine
99.Description: You may use 1 Animal for any 1 Resource.
99.Snark: Ever heard of a meat building?

100.Title: The Payoff Payoff
100.Description: 2 VPs for each Payoff you have placed.
100.Snark: The only thing better than VPs are VPs that spawned from the production of other VPs.

102.Title: The Easily-Disrupted Payoff
102.Description: 8 VPs  if you have Rotating Advantage. at the end of the game. Once you play this card, you may not steal Rotating Advantage.
102.Snark: I REALLY hope nobody notices that I played this.

103.Title: The Unexpected Payoff
103.Description: 5 VP if you have 1 Glass, 1 Gold, and 1 Vegetable.
103.Snark: This card favors those who have this deck memorized.

104.Title: The Suboptimal Strategy Payoff
104.Description: 1 VP for each type of Resource.
104.Snark: This is to make you feel better about having unused stuff.

105.Title: The Early Investment Payoff
105.Snark: See! I told you that card would pay off.

106.Title: The Low-Risk Payoff
106.Description: 1 VP for each Wood, Sheep, or Grain
106.Snark: Hey, at least you know nobody else is going for it.

107.Title: The Payoff With Math
107.Description: The number of Glass you have in your hand squared plus the number of Silks you have.
107.Snark: Go ahead and take your next turn, this is gonna take me a moment.

108.Title: The Military Payoff
108.Description: 2 VP for each Military, +2 additional VP if you end the game with the most military (ties don't count).

109.Title: The Building Payoff Building
109.Description: 2 VP for each Building you've played
109.Snark: You had to see this one coming.
